title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 50-4.8 - Employee attestation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 50-4.8 - Employee attestation

State Regulations

Each employee, upon receiving training, in conformance with section
50-4.7
of this Subpart, shall sign a statement acknowledging receipt of sections 50- 4.3(b) and 50-4.7(b) of this Subpart and acknowledging that violation of confidentiality statutes and rules may lead to disciplinary action, including suspension or dismissal from employment and criminal prosecution. Each employee's signed attestation is to be centrally maintained in the employee's personal history file. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
50-4.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
